output: WindowShadingControl has to be used with either method even if the shade is in place at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What should the user specify in the associated DX coil object for an air-to-water heat pump?
output: The user should specify a Total Heating Capacity Modifier Curve Name (function of water flow fraction) and a Heating COP Modifier Curve Name (function of water flow fraction) to account for differences in capacity and power consumption at the off-rated water flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is the 'Cooling Coil Stage 2 Runtime Fraction' applicable?
output: Applicable only for COIL Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoStageWithHumidityControlMode when 2 capacity stages are specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: This output variable is only available for a storage type of Water or UserDefinedFluidType.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: The Total Cooling Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name for Speed 10 is HPACCoolCapFT.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text

output: Input the single schedule name in the Humidifying Setpoint Schedule Name field and leave the Dehumidifying Setpoint Schedule Name blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the 'Front side' of a window layer?
output: 'Front side' is the side of the layer opposite the zone in which the window is defined.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

output: The Zone Secondary Recirculation Fraction is 0.3.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: Is the 'Heating Design Capacity W' input field autosizable?
output: Yes this input field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: Design Air Flow Rate U-Factor Times Area Value

output: ZoneAverageSurface Window Solar Vertical Profile Angle[deg]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

output: 'FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity' means the program calculates the design heating capacity from user specified fraction and the auto-sized design heating capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Python Plugins / Python EMS -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What should be done if the Performance Input Method is specified as NominalCapacity?
output: If Performance Input Method is specified as NominalCapacity then the field must be left blank since the model automatically calculates the tower UA based on the tower capacity specified in the field Free Convection Capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What must be included in fin placement relative to the edge of the glass?
output: Fin placement is relative to the edge of the glass and user must include the frame width when a frame is present.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Defrost Time Period Fraction' field define?
output: This numeric field defines the fraction of compressor runtime.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: To what does the Reference Cooling Capacity correspond?
output: It corresponds to the highest load side heat transfer rate listed in the catalog data.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What is the default schedule value if the 'Severity Schedule Name' field is blank for 'FaultModel:Fouling:Coil'?
output: If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 (no changes to fouling) for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> equation
input: What is the example value for index of refraction \(n\)?
output: The example value for \(n\) is 1.526.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is 'Zone Cooltower Water Volume'?
output: The water consumption includes not only the direct thermodynamics of water evaporation but also other sources of consumption such as drift or concentration blow down specified by users throughout all processes during the operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: How does the UniformLoad distribution scheme operate?
output: UniformLoad evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of the total cooling capacity modifier curve (function of temperature)?
output: The purpose of this curve is to be multiplied by the gross rated total cooling capacity to give the gross total cooling capacity at specific temperature operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Drift Loss Percent'?
output: The default value is 0.008%.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Coefficient4 C4' field?
output: The required numeric constant coefficient C_4 in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Chilled Water Thermal Storage Source Side Heat Transfer Rate' indicate?
output: The average heat transfer rate between the source side water and the tank water in watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the Curve:CubicLinear function?
output: This curve is a function of two independent variables. Input consists of the curve name the six coefficients and min and max values for each of the independent variables. Optional inputs for curve minimum and maximum may be used to limit the output of the performance curve (e.g. limit extrapolation).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Ceiling:Interzone object?
output: The Ceiling:Interzone object is used to describe interior ceilings that separate zones of differing conditions and expect heat transfer through the ceiling from the adjacent zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: The table lists models associated with specific integer codes
input: What is the related key and model for report code 321?
output: The related key and model for report code 321 is 'AlamdariHammondVerticalWall'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the 'Low Speed Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity' field used for?
output: The 'Low Speed Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity' field is used to define the total full load gross total cooling capacity (sensible plus latent) in watts of the DX coil unit for low speed compressor and low speed fan at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the type of output for 'Cooling Coil Water Heating Pump Electricity Energy'?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What does the System Node Generic Air Contaminant Concentration represent?
output: The average generic contaminant concentration in parts per million (ppm) at a system node for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What type of fan and compressor operation does the model support?
output: This model only supports continuous fan and cycling compressor operation -- cycling fan modeling is not available with this model.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What do the People Sensible Heating Rate and Energy output variables represent?
output: These output variables are the amount of sensible heat gain for this People object in Watts (for rate) or Joules. This amount is based on the number of people in the space as well as the total amount of energy produced by a typical person defined by the activity schedule in the input. An internal algorithm (described in the Engineering Reference document) is used to determine what fraction of the total is sensible and what fraction is latent. The sensible plus the latent heat gain from people equals the total gain specified in the input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the default schedule value if the schedule field is left blank?
output: If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'EMS Program or Subroutine Name' field?
output: The 'EMS Program or Subroutine Name' field identifies which program uses the variable if it is a local scope variable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text

output: The 'Name' field must match the name of a material defined elsewhere in EnergyPlus with its thermal properties overridden by the properties in this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What does the Heat Recovery Heating Energy Time Constant field define?
output: This numeric field defines the heating energy time constant in hours used to model the time it takes for the system to change from cooling only operation to simultaneous cooling and heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How should objects be modeled in the AirflowNetwork model?
output: These objects should be modeled with no outdoor air flow rate or in the case of a ZoneHVAC:EnergyRecoveryVentilator with a balanced air flow (same supply airflow rate as exhaust airflow rate).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

output: If the user enters a valid schedule name the maximum temperature values specified in this schedule will override the constant value specified in the Maximum Indoor Temperature field.

output: The 'Design Water Temperature Difference' input field is optional and if specified is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate. If blank or omitted the Loop Design Temperature Difference value specified in the Sizing:Plant object is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate.

output: The number specified in this field will be multiplied by the total energy consumed by gas equipment to give the amount of heat which is 'lost' and does not impact the zone energy balances.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: How should you model a thermal zone to correctly calculate both direct and inter-reflected daylight illuminance?
output: You should try to model a thermal zone consisting of several similar rooms separated by interior walls as a representative room with a zone multiplier.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: It permits heat exchange between adjacent zones (interzone heat transfer) when multiple zones are simulated but can also be used to simulate middle zone behavior without modeling the adjacent zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: Yes it is assumed to be the same for front and back sides.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: This field is a key/choice field that tells which of the next two fields are filled and describes the method for calculating the clothing insulation value of occupants.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: HVAC: Primary and Secondary Systems -> text
input: What can zone equipment include?
output: Zone equipment can include dampers and reheat coils as well as zone specific conditioning systems such as thermostatic baseboard or a window air conditioner.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

output: $\DeltaH_NPL$ represents the height from the midpoint of the lower opening to the neutral pressure level in meters (m).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What optional schedule can be specified for defrost periods?
output: An optional defrost drip-down schedule can be specified to allow additional time for melted frost to drain from the cooling coil following the regular defrost period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Packaged Terminal Heat Pump Latent Cooling Energy' output field represent?
output: This output field is the latent heat extraction (dehumidification) of the packaged terminal heat pump from the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> text
input: What should all the rows outside of the start and end date range of the HybridModel be?
output: All the rows outside of the start and end date range of the HybridModel should be zeros.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 5 Reference Unit Rated air flow rate?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Air Outlet Node Name' field specify?
output: The name of the air node that connects this terminal unit to the zone. The will be the same as one of the zone inlet nodes. The name of this node must be entered even if the actual beams are passive and is not actually supplying air to the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the consequence of using setpoint control strategies?
output: It will more closely match the operation of an actual thermostat but it will require significantly longer execution times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is an earth tube?
output: An earth tube is a long underground metal or plastic pipe through which air is drawn.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does a value of 1 indicate in the Zone Air Terminal Current Operation Control Stage?
output: Value = 1 => Constant speed cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What additional equipment is needed when using the AirTerminal:DualDuct:VAV:OutdoorAir system in zones that need heat?
output: Additional ZoneHVAC equipment such as baseboards or fan coil units are needed to provide heating to the zone when using this air terminal.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Load Side Reference Flow Rate' define?
output: This autosizable field defines the reference load side flow rate for the heat pump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the output of the curve used in the 'Heat Reclaim Efficiency Function of Temperature Curve Name' field?
output: The output of this curve is multiplied by the rated heat reclaim recovery efficiency to give the heat reclaim efficiency at specific operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the role of the EnergyPlus ground loop heat exchanger?
output: The EnergyPlus ground loop heat exchanger is a condenser component that serves the condenser supply side in addition to the cooling towers and other condensing components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does a Design Specification Zone HVAC Sizing object define?
output: A Design Specification Zone HVAC Sizing object defines scalable sizing methods for sizing input fields such as Maximum Air Flow Rate in this Window Air Conditioner zone HVAC object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'DrawThrough' choice represent in the 'Fan Placement' field?
output: It represents a draw through system where the supply air fan is between the DX cooling/heating coil and the supplementary heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the 'Length' field represent?
output: This field is the length of the subsurface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Air Outlet Node Name' field specify?
output: The 'Air Outlet Node Name' field specifies the name of the HVAC system node to which the DX cooling coil sends its outlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> table: Solar Absorptivity for Kynar(R) Paint Colors
input: What is the solar absorptivity of Concord Cream Kynar(R) paint?
output: The solar absorptivity of Concord Cream Kynar(R) paint is 0.45.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the effective EIR calculated?
output: The product of the rated EIR and EIR modifier curves is divided by the output of this curve to give the effective EIR for a given simulation timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the field 'Left Fin Distance Above Top of Window'?
output: This field is the distance from the top of the window to the top of the left fin (meters) and is relative to the edge of the glass and includes the frame width when a frame is present.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the optional numeric input field for minimum outdoor air humidity ratio specify in Mode #?
output: This optional numeric input field specifies the minimum outdoor air humidity ratio at which Mode # is allowed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the unit for Refrigeration Zone Air Chiller Total Cooling Rate?
output: The unit for Refrigeration Zone Air Chiller Total Cooling Rate is Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the Temperature Termination Defrost Fraction to Ice field specify?
output: When cooling coils go through a defrost cycle only a portion of the defrost energy is actually used to melt the ice. The rest of the defrost energy goes to increasing the temperature of the coils themselves and to the walkin environment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: When is the 'Water Coil Controller Name' field required?
output: This field is only required for the water coils i.e. the coil type is Coil:Heating:Water Coil:Cooling:Water or Coil:Cooling:Water:Detailedgeometry.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does a 'Cover Evaporation Factor' of 0 mean?
output: A 'Cover Evaporation Factor' of 0 means the pool cover has no effect on evaporation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Key choice and Applies to Inside or Outside
input: What does the 'TARP' key choice apply to?
output: Both

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the relative humidity of the air entering the ITE?
output: The dewpoint temperature of the air entering the ITE.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the HVAC Sum Chiller Heater Condenser Heat Transfer Energy measured in?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 3 Gross Rated Heating COP?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What is the purpose of the field 'Maximum Number of HVAC Sizing Simulation Passes'?
output: This field is used to manually place an upper limit on the number of passes that the sizing algorithms can use.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What are specified with a quadratic curve fit in the combustion turbine model?
output: Recoverable fuel energy equipment recoverable lube oil heat/fuel energy input equipment performance total exhaust heat/fuel energy input equipment exhaust gas temperature/fuel energy input equipment performance parameters are all specified with a quadratic curve fit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: How is the VRF Heat Pump Cycling Ratio value calculated and reported?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system time step being simulated and the results are averaged for the time step being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the defining equation for capacity?
output: The defining equation is: AvailToNominalCapacityRatio = C_1 + C_2Δ_temp + C_3Δ_temp^2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the runtime fraction of the coil defined?
output: The runtime fraction of the coil is defined as PLR/PLF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What effect does the 'Fraction of Input that Is Lost' have on the zone heat balances?
output: This energy is a loss term and this fraction of the input power has no effect on the zone heat balances.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: Is there a default value for the Rated Total Heating Power?
output: This value is required and has no default value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the Water System Roof Irrigation Scheduled Depth represent?
output: This is the scheduled amount of irrigation for the green roof (ecoroof) based on the user input. Amount is measured in meters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the VRF Heat Pump Cooling Electricity Energy?
output: It is a sum HVAC output variable measured in Joules (J).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What temperatures are included in the zone temperature options?
output: The zone temperature options include the zone mean air temperature the zone mean radiant temperature the zone operative temperature the surface temperature of the ventilated slab the outdoor dry-bulb temperature the outdoor wet-bulb temperature or the dewpoint temperature of zone mean air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Fluid Properties -> listing
input: Provide an example of a statement in an input data file for glycol concentration.
output: FluidProperties:GlycolConcentration EthGly25Percent EthyleneGlycol 0.25; FluidProperties:GlycolConcentration ProGly40Percent PropyleneGlycol 0.40; FluidProperties:GlycolConcentration HalfAndHalf UserDefinedGlycolType NewBrine 0.5;

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> table row: PerfLog Mode Columns
input: What are the column headers in the 'PerfLog Mode Columns' table?
output: The column headers are: Run Direct Coil Radiant Algorithm Override Mode Num of Timesteps [#/hour] Min Warmup Suppress Resets System Timestep [minute] PsyTsatFnPb MaxZone TempDiff MaxAllowed DelTemp Runtime [second].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: Is the 'Electric Meter <#> Name' field extensible?
output: Yes this field is extensible so additional fields of this type can be added to the end of this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What action is taken if the exiting water temperature remains above the set point after 'free convection' is modeled?
output: The tower fan is turned on to reduce the exiting water temperature to the set point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: How is the rated cooling source temperature used?
output: This number is used with temperatures for other refrigeration loads on any one system to set that system's minimum suction pressure or minimum circulating fluid temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: Where is the air flow rate used for reheat coil sizing reported?
output: It is reported with other component sizing information as 'Reheat Coil Sizing Air Volume Flow Rate'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What does the 'Footing Wall Construction Name' field define?
output: The 'Footing Wall Construction Name' field defines the construction of the foundation footing wall for slab foundations where the foundation wall is not exposed to the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: Where is the syntax for the condensate pump provided?
output: The syntax for condensate pump is given below.

output: Boiler:Steam Steam Boiler Plant Boiler !- Boiler Name NaturalGas !- Fuel Type 160000 !-Maximum Boiler Pressure Pascal 0.8 !- Theoretical Boiler Efficiency 115 !- Max Design Outlet Steam Temp 300000 !- Nominal Capacity W 0.00001 !- Minimum Part Load Ratio 1.0 !- Maximum Part Load Ratio 0.2 !- Optimum Part Load Ratio 0.8!- Coefficient 1 of the fuel use/part load ratio curve 0.1!- Coefficient 2 of the fuel use/part load ratio curve 0.1!- Coefficient 3 of the fuel use/part load ratio curve Steam Boiler Plant Boiler Inlet Node !- Boiler Steam Inlet Node Steam Boiler Plant Boiler Outlet Node; !- Plant Loop Outlet Node Boiler:Steam Steam Boiler Plant Boiler !- Boiler Name NaturalGas !- Fuel Type 160000

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the definition of the 'Unitary System Fan Part Load Ratio'?
output: This output variable is the ratio of actual air mass flow rate through the unitary system to the unitary system's design air mass flow rate (i.e. design volumetric flow rate converted to dry air mass flow rate).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the alpha field for simulation timestep indicate?
output: It indicates whether the domain will update temperatures at each zone timestep or at hourly intervals.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: Where are unit ventilators typically used?
output: Unit ventilators are typically used in classrooms or other applications where ventilation is a priority.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What does the Field: HVAC Air Loop Name specify?
output: The Field: HVAC Air Loop Name specifies the name of the AirLoopHVAC object (the central air system) which will use this setpoint manager to set its humidification setpoint (minimum air humidity ratio).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What can the user specify if the gas cooler is not at ground level?
output: The user may specify an air inlet node name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is an optional fan total efficiency ratio curve used for?
output: An optional fan total efficiency ratio curve is available to model efficiency differences at alternate fan speeds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Heating Coil Heating Energy variable represent?
output: The Heating Coil Heating Energy variable represents the total heating output of the coil in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does the Zone Air Terminal Heating Energy field report?
output: This field reports the dry air heat addition of the parallel PIU terminal unit to the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Field: Supply Water Monitoring Node Name define?
output: This alpha field defines a water side node to monitor the supply water amount after the water heating operation of the integrated heat pump is turned on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What materials can be used for fluid tanks?
output: The material can be water or a user-defined fluid such as a glycol.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What are the two options for the unit control type field?
output: The two options for this field are Neutral or Temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Heating Coil Capacity
input: What is the second entry in the table?
output: Heating Coil Capacity

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the high humidity control setting in the unitary system?
output: High humidity control is set to 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What are the window vertices specified in?
output: The window vertices are specified in the FenestrationSurface:Detailed object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the exhaust fan name is left blank?
output: If the exhaust fan name is left blank the field 'Exhaust Air Flow Rate' will be ignored and automatically set to be equal to zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Coil Object Type' field denote?
output: This alpha field denotes the type of chilled-water cooling coil being modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is required when modeling multi-speed fan operation with the 'Fan:OnOff' object?
output: When modeling multi-speed fan operation with the 'Fan:OnOff' object it must be used as part of a compound object that allows multiple fan speeds such as 'AirLoopHVAC:Unitary:Furnace:HeatCool' or 'ZoneHVAC:PackagedTerminalAirConditioner'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> equation
input: What is the equation used to determine the ground water depth based on elevation?
output: The equation used is \(d_wt=0.1022\cdot d_elev\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Fluid Properties -> text
input: How does each temperature in the temperature list correspond to data items?
output: Each temperature in the temperature list corresponds to a data item found in the remaining fields of this syntax.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How does the zone water source heat pump operate when the speed ratio is 0.4 and the speed number is 3?
output: When the speed ratio is 0.4 and the speed number is 3 the zone water source heat pump operates at Speed 3 for 40% of a system timestep and at Speed 2 for 60% of a system timestep for a multiple speed fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What options does the Coil Option field allow the user to specify?
output: The Coil Option field allows the user to specify options as None Heating Cooling or HeatingAndCooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What should the 'Air Inlet Node Name' be?
output: This should be either one of zone exhaust nodes for the zone which the fan coil unit is serving or an induced air outlet node to draw air from a return plenum when the zone return node is connected to a return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the 'Wall Interface Temperature' represent?
output: It represents the SurfaceProperty:OtherSideConditionsModel surface temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: Is the Condenser Outlet Node Name required for all chillers?
output: It is required for WaterCooled chillers but not for AirCooled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the range of the slat angle?
output: The slat angle varies between -90 to +90 degrees.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is the legacy method used by older fan objects prior to version 8.6?
output: The legacy method used by older fan objects prior to version 8.6 is the TotalEfficiencyAndPressure method.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Outdoor Air Inlet Node Name' field specify?
output: This optional alpha field specifies the outdoor air node name used to define the conditions of the air entering the cooling tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: Is the Zone sizing object required for the Cooling Design Supply Air Flow Rate Per Unit Cooling Capacity?
output: Yes the Zone sizing object (Sizing:Zone) is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What type of equation is used for the heating energy input ratio modifier function of low part-load ratio curve?
output: This curve is a linear quadratic or cubic equation with heating part-load ratio used as the independent variable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the name of the Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:VariableSpeed object?
output: HPWHPlantDXCoilVS

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How does the zone evaporative cooler unit operate?
output: It always draws 100% of its supply air from the outside passes the air through a supply fan and evaporative cooler(s) and then into the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Circulating Fluid Type' specify?
output: The 'Field: Circulating Fluid Type' specifies whether the fluid is always liquid (e.g. glycol solution) or undergoes a partial phase change (e.g. CO2 liquid overfeed system).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Python Plugins / Python EMS -> text
input: What new applications were enabled by the Energy Management System?
output: The Energy Management System opened the door to new applications including evaluation of custom control strategies or custom physical component models.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 0 denote in the context of defrost drip-down periods?
output: A value equal to 0 denotes that the defrost drip-down period is over.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the range and default value for the fraction of tower capacity in the free convection regime?
output: The fraction of tower capacity in free convection regime must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 0.2 with a default value of 0.125 if this field is left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the ratio of compressor size to total compressor capacity?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Heating Coil Runtime Fraction represent?
output: This is the runtime fraction of the DX coil compressor and condenser fan(s) for the time step being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> listing
input: Provide an example IDF for the steam baseboard design object.
output: An example IDF for the steam baseboard design object is: ZoneHVAC:Baseboard:RadiantConvective:Steam:Design SPACE1-1 Baseboard Design !- Design Object Name HeatingDesignCapacity !- Heating Design Capacity Method  !- Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area  !- Fraction of Autosized Heating Design Capacity 0.001 !- Convergence Tolerance 0.3 !- Fraction Radiant 0.3; !- Fraction of Radiant Energy Incident on People

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative / -> text
input: What do the pairs of inputs (surface name and fraction of radiant energy) specify?
output: They specify where this radiant energy is coming from.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is reported if the condition is not met?
output: Otherwise a zero is reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What must be specified for the meter in the EnergyPlus Input-Output Reference?
output: The resource type must be specified for the meter and all assignments to this meter will be checked to assure that the same resource type is used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: When are leap days required?
output: Leap days are required when using actual weather but will be processed and used during leap years when the days are present in the weather file and enabled in the weather file header.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Outdoor Air Stream Node Name'?
output: The 'Outdoor Air Stream Node Name' is used to obtain the flow rate of the outdoor air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does Heating Coil Heating Rate represent?
output: Heating Coil Heating Rate is the rate of heat transfer taking place in the coil at the operating conditions. The units are (J/sec) or Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What happens if the cooling design capacity input field is left blank or zero?
output: If this input field is left blank or zero then autosizing is assumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction' field?
output: The 'Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction' field specifies the minimum flow rate to the zone while the system is operating as a fraction of the maximum air flow rate to meet minimum ventilation requirements for occupants.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the concatenated name used for in EnergyPlus?
output: The concatenated name is used when referring to specific instances of internal gains for Output:Variables Energy Management System (EMS) controls and Demand Limiting Controls.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Circuit Length' field specify?
output: The length in meters of each parallel hydronic circuit in a surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the result of the curve multiplied by in the context of modeling capacity at temperatures away from the rating point?
output: The result of the curve is multiplied by Cooling And Discharge Mode Rated Storage Discharging Capacity to model capacity at temperatures away from the rating point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: How many case defrost types can the user select from?
output: The user can select from eight case defrost types with additional inputs being required depending on the type selected.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What can be done for better accuracy with complex plants regarding 'Maximum Plant Iterations'?
output: This value can be raised for better accuracy with complex plants or lowered for faster speed with simple plants.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: Can information from one 'ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:ConstantFlow:Design' object be shared with several ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:ConstantFlow objects?
output: Yes the information from one ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:ConstantFlow:Design object can be shared with several ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:ConstantFlow objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Speed <x> Reference Unit Rated Air Flow Rate' define?
output: This numeric field defines the volumetric air flow rate in \\( \\si\\volumeFlowRate \\) across the cooling coil at rated conditions for Speed <x> operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Transition Zone Length field?
output: This is used for determining heat gains due to solar absorbed by the pipe in each transition zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the alpha field for vertical insulation indicate?
output: It indicates whether vertical insulation is present.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What is the transition height specified in the configuration?
output: The transition height specified is 1.7 meters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the negative sign in the Secondary Coil Total Heat Removal Rate indicate?
output: The negative sign indicates that heat is removed from the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: When is the Maximum Carbon Dioxide Concentration Schedule Name field used?
output: This field is used when the field System Outdoor Air Method is set to ProportionalControlBasedOnOccupancySchedule ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOccupancy or ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOARate in the Controller:MechanicalVentilation object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the heating design capacity method?
output: The heating design capacity method is HeatingDesignCapacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the internal gain applied when using a Space Name?
output: Space Name will result in one instance of the internal gain named <Object Name>. The full magnitude of the gain will be applied to the Space using the design level space floor area or space occupancy as appropriate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the Field: Design Outlet Steam Temperature specify?
output: The maximum value of steam temperature the boiler can provide. (Celsius)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does a schedule value less than or equal to 0 signify for a component's operation?
output: A value less than or equal to 0 (usually 0 is used) denotes that the component must be off for the time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: IDD -- IP Units -> table or table row: Default IP conversions
input: What is the conversion factor from g/m-s-K to lb/ft-s-F?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What should the field 'Name' contain for a steam baseboard heater unit design object?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the Unitary System Compressor Part Load Ratio?

The runtime fraction for the heat pump compressor may be different from the compressor part-load ratio reported here due to the part-load performance of the heating/cooling coil (delay at start-up to reach steady-state output). In general runtime fractions are reported by individual components where appropriate.
