instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> listing

output: AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Component:Duct MainTruck1 3.0 0.6 0.2827 0.0009 0.01 0.772 0.0001;

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text

output: The pump will operate and select a flow somewhere between the minimum and maximum limits.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What will be reported during sizing when the Sensible Load option is used?
output: Latent loads will also be reported during sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: Is the design supply air temperature for heating used for sizing zone equipment?
output: Yes the design supply air temperature for heating is used for the sizing of zone equipment (e.g. reheat coil) for systems embedded with central heating coils but it is not used if there is no central heating coil in the system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text

output: A unique user-defined name for an instance of this availability manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

input: What is the Condenser Air Flow Rate Fraction for the three-speed cooling coil speed 1?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: 2 people

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

output: This numeric field contains the thermal conductivity of the filler material in W/m-K.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the performance curve normalized?
output: The performance curve is normalized to have the value of 1.0 at the rating point which is defined to be x = 19.4°C y = 35.0°C and z = 0.5 for Ice storage type or z = Fluid Storage Tank Rating Temperature when storage type is Water or UserDefinedFluidType.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens to the 'Surface Inside Face Interior Movable Insulation Temperature' when the movable insulation is not present?
output: For surfaces that have no movable insulation or the movable insulation is not scheduled to be present the value of this variable is set to the Surface Inside Face Temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Time Constant' numeric field define?
output: This numeric field defines the cooling energy time constant in hours used to model the time it takes for the system to transition from cooling only operation to simultaneous cooling and heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the Ambient Temperature Outdoor Air Node Name field specify?
output: This optional alpha field specifies the outdoor air node name used to define the ambient conditions surrounding the water heater tank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the number of vertices?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: How is the tank indirectly charged in the ThermalStorage:ChilledWater:Mixed object?
output: The tank is indirectly charged by circulating cold water through the 'Source Side' of the water tank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What is the Heat Exchanger Total Heating Rate?
output: This output is the total heating rate of the supply air by the heat exchanger in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What should the 'Zone Relief Air Node Name' match?
output: This node name would match the name of a zone exhaust air node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the output 'Refrigeration Air Chiller System Mechanical Subcooler Heat Transfer Rate [W]' represent?
output: This output represents the cooling energy transferred from one system's compressor group to the refrigerant leaving the condenser for another refrigeration system in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is required for the 'FluidPhaseChange' input variable?
output: For 'FluidPhaseChange' this numeric field should be the evaporator capacity (W) at full-load design conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the 'Chiller COP' calculated for electric chillers?
output: For electric chillers 'Chiller COP' is calculated as the evaporator heat transfer rate divided by the Chiller Electricity Rate [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: How is the time interval between rotations determined?
output: The time interval between rotations is set by the 'Rotation Duration' field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: This alpha field defines the name of the HVAC system node from which the DX heating coil draws its inlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How is power loss during conversion treated?
output: The power lost during the conversion process is treated as heat gains and added to the thermal zone named in this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How does the parasitic power affect the zone air?
output: The model assumes that this parasitic power contributes to heating the zone air (i.e. affects the zone air heat balance).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Example IDF entry for SurfaceProperty:ExteriorNaturalVentedCavity
input: What is the Ratio of Actual surface area to projected surface area in the example IDF entry?
output: The Ratio of Actual surface area to projected surface area is 0.97.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What outputs are available if the rack serves cases and/or walk-ins?
output: If the rack serves cases and/or walk-ins the outputs available are: ZoneAverage Refrigeration Compressor Rack Electricity Rate [W] ZoneSum Refrigeration Compressor Rack Electricity Energy [J] ZoneAverage Refrigeration Compressor Rack Condenser Fan Electricity Rate [W] ZoneSum Refrigeration Compressor Rack Condenser Fan Electricity Energy [J] ZoneAverage Refrigeration Compressor Rack Total Heat Transfer Rate [W] ZoneSum Refrigeration Compressor Rack Total Heat Transfer Energy [J] ZoneAverage Refrigeration Compressor Rack COP [W/W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does mode 4 denote for the chiller-heater?
output: Mode 4 denotes that at least one of the chiller-heater modules in the central heat pump system provides both cooling and heating and the chiller-heater is meeting remaining cooling demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Crankcase Heater Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name' field?
output: The field contains the name of a normalized Curve:* or Table:Lookup object encoding the relationship between the crankcase heater capacity and the outdoor air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What is DeltaT_ai in 'Field: Pair <#> Delta Adjacent Air Temperature'?
output: DeltaT_ai is the temperature difference between the air temperature at the associated Zeta (T_ai) and the mean air temperature and is given in degrees Celsius. This object is extensible so additional pairs of these last two fields of this type can be added to the end of this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text

output: Curve:Quadratic

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: The unit for 'Surface Outside Face Incident Solar Radiation Rate per Area' is Watts per square meter [W/m2].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> table row: Metabolic Rates for Various Activities

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> Section: Daylighting:Controls -> Inputs -> text

output: This numeric field specifies the effectiveness at design flow rate that is applied to the wetbulb depression to determine the conditions leaving the cooler.

input: List some of the output variables related to AirflowNetwork zone infiltration and ventilation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: For ASHRAE90VariableFan a Fan:SystemModel Fan:OnOff or Fan:VariableVolume should be chosen.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: This numeric field defines the ratio of the initial moisture evaporation rate from the cooling coil (when the compressor first turns off in Watts) and the coil's steady-state latent capacity (Watts) at rated airflow and temperature conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the field 'Reference Heating Mode Cooling Capacity Ratio' contain?
output: This numeric field contains the evaporator's capacity during the reference heating-only or simultaneous cooling-heating mode as a ratio of reference cooling capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: How does the return air fraction affect the case credits?
output: This return air fraction affects the portion of the case credits (sensible and latent) that are applied to the air returning to the HVAC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What are the rules for PLF values between 0 and 1?
output: For PLR values between 0 and 1 (0 <= PLR < 1) the following rules apply: PLF >= 0.7 and PLF >= PLR.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Python Plugins / Python EMS -> text
input: What are the two special areas of data storage available to plugins in EnergyPlus?
output: The two areas are Global variables and Trend variables.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: How do the controls for the radiant system use the 'Maximum Cold Water Flow' field?
output: The controls for the radiant system will vary the flow rate of cold water through the surface using zero flow and the maximum flow rate specified in this field as the lower and upper bounds respectively.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

output: If more than one curve is referenced or non-blank then they are all used and the result is the simple addition of all the curve results.

output: Fan:ConstantVolume is used when the Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule values are never 0 and the fan operates continuously.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: The curve is normalized to have the value of 1.0 at the rating point to provide a standard reference for comparing the EIR at specific temperature operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

output: The part load fraction (PLF) correlation accounts for efficiency losses due to compressor cycling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What does the SetpointManager:CondenserEnteringReset:Ideal object determine?
output: The object determines a near-optimal condenser water entering setpoint at each time step that will result in minimum net energy consumption for the chiller and cooling tower plant.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Mixing Total Heat Loss Energy' paragraph describe?
output: The total heat loss due to the sum of mixing cross-mixing and refrigeration-door mixing that occurs when the sum of Zone Mixing Sensible Heat Gain Energy and Zone Mixing Latent Heat Gain Energy is less than the sum of Zone Mixing Sensible Heat Loss Energy and Zone Mixing Latent Heat Loss Energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text

output: Regardless of this schedule the basin heater may only operate when the DX coil is off.

output: This autosizable field defines the reference load side cooling capacity for the heat pump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the fraction of the time period that the heater was running?
output: The fraction of the time period that the heater was running.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How are the inlet air properties determined when using the exhaust node?
output: The inlet air properties are combined properties with mixing mass flow rates of both nodes and added lights heat gain.

input: What is the cooling speed 1 supply air flow ratio?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens in the cooling operating mode?
output: In the cooling operating mode the primary DX cooling coil of a DX system serving a primary zone is active and heat is rejected by the secondary coil (condenser) into a secondary zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What does the field 'Zone or Space Name' specify?
output: The field 'Zone or Space Name' specifies the name of the Zone or Space in which the reference point is located.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the Dehumidification Control Type value?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does Construction:AirBoundary indicate?
output: Construction:AirBoundary indicates an open boundary between two zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is Coefficient4 y for the Curve:Biquadratic for Energy Input?
output: Coefficient4 y for the Curve:Biquadratic for Energy Input is '-0.00303753'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: Does hot water flow modulation through the reheat coil require an additional controller?
output: No it does not require an additional controller or Controller:WaterCoil object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Fluid Properties -> text
input: How is superheated refrigerant data indexed?
output: Saturated refrigerant data is indexed according to pressure and quality.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: When is the 'Time for Tank Recovery' field used?
output: This field is only used if the Design Mode is 'PeakDraw'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the DrawThrough choice represent in the Fan Placement field?
output: The DrawThrough choice represents a system where the supply fan is between the WaterToAirHeatPump cooling/heating coil and the supplementary heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What happens if the 'Maximum Fraction of Outdoor Air Schedule Name' field is blank?
output: If this schedule name is blank then it is not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is COP defined in this context?
output: COP is the total cooling power output in watts divided by the electric power input in watts and is dimensionless.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What is illustrated in Figure 2?
output: Figure 2 illustrates a diagram of a central heat pump system with chiller-heaters in various modes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name' used for?
output: This alpha field contains the name of the basin heater operating schedule applicable for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> equation
input: What is the formula for the AirFlowScaleFactor?
output: AirFlowScaleFactor = RatedVolumetricAirFlowRate / (ReferenceUnitVolAirFlowRate@NominalSpeedLevel × CapacityScaleFactor)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What should user-defined temperature distributions be balanced about?
output: They should be balanced about the mean so that basic conservation of energy laws are not violated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the Refrigeration Air Chiller System Condenser Evaporated Water Volume measure?
output: It measures the water consumed by evaporation in cubic meters (m³) while providing evaporative cooling of the condenser for the reported timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'WindowGap:DeflectionState' input object?
output: This input object is used to enter data describing deflection state of the gap. It is referenced from WindowMaterial:Gap object only and it is used only when deflection model is set to MeasuredDeflection otherwise it is ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What does the field 'Heating Sizing Factor' refer to?
output: The global heating sizing ratio applied to all of the zone design heating loads and air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What is depicted in the figure with the image path 'media/NFRC100-Table4-3.PNG'?
output: The figure depicts 'NFRC 100 Product Types and Model Sizes'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the role of the Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:Wrapped object?
output: Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:Wrapped is required for modeling a wrapped condenser heat pump water heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the default outer diameter for hydronic tubing?
output: The default for this parameter is 0.016 meters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: Is a zone name included as an input to the zone outdoor air definition?
output: No a zone name is not included as an input to this zone outdoor air definition.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the role of the 'Source Side Flow Control Mode' in the context of deadband temperature difference?
output: How the 'Deadband Temperature Difference' is used is dependent on the 'Source Side Flow Control Mode' choice.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table row: Heating Design Capacity W
input: What is specified by 'Heating Design Capacity W' in the table?
output: It is a row in the table indicating a specification related to heating design capacity in watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Condenser Water Pump Power' define?
output: This numeric field defines the DX coil's condenser pump power in Watts. This is the operating pump power as installed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> Outputs -> listing
input: List the third node and its attributes from the eplusout.bnd file example.
output: Node3MIXED AIR NODE 1Air5

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What advantage does using a multiplier provide?
output: Using Multiplier can save input effort and calculation time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the numeric field for Fraction of Motor Inefficiencies to Fluid Stream contain?
output: This numeric field contains the pump motor's fraction of power loss to the fluid.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What are the two choices for calculating occupancy-based outdoor air rate?
output: The two choices are ProportionalControlBasedOnOccupancySchedule and ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOccupancy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> equation
input: What is the formula for the solar collector heat exchanger effectiveness?
output: The formula is \\(\\varepsilon_HX = \\fracT_aHX - T_ambT_scoll - T_amb\\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Indoor Unit Reference Subcooling' define?
output: This numeric field defines the reference subcooling degrees of the indoor unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the scaled Maximum Air Flow Rate size?
output: The scaled Maximum Air Flow Rate is used to size the heating capacity of the unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> table
input: What are the outputs listed in the itemized list?
output: The outputs are: HVACAverageDistrict Heating Steam Rate [W] HVACSumDistrict Heating Steam Energy [J] ZoneMeterDistrictHeatingSteam:Plant [J] ZoneMeterHeating:DistrictHeatingSteam [J] HVACAverageDistrict Heating Steam Inlet Temperature [C] HVACAverageDistrict Heating Steam Outlet Temperature [C] HVACAverageDistrict Heating Steam Mass Flow Rate [kg/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does a control stage value of 2 indicate for a PIU terminal?
output: Value = 2 => Constant speed heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How is the maximum volume flow rate during reheat operation determined using Maximum Flow Fraction During Reheat?
output: This fraction is multiplied by the Maximum Air Flow Rate to determine the maximum volume flow rate (m³/s) allowed during reheat operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Field: Rated Water Flow Rate contain?
output: This numeric field contains the rated volumetric water flow rate on the source side of the heat pump in m3/s. This field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What determines the time step being reported for the coil?
output: The time step being reported is determined by the inlet and outlet air conditions and the air mass flow rate through the coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Z Height' describe?
output: The height or elevation of the grid of daylighting points.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Minimum Hot Water or Steam Flow Rate' set to?
output: This field is ignored for gas and electric coils. Set to the minimum design water or steam volumetric flow rate in m³/s for the hot water or steam heating coil normally set to be a shut-off valve that is set to zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Fan Speed Control Type' specify?
output: The type of fan speed control used by the condenser fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the Field: Third Fuel Type specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the fuel type associated with the Table:Lookup object specified in field System Third Fuel Consumption Lookup Table. Valid choices include: None Electricity NaturalGas Propane FuelOilNo1 FuelOilNo2 Diesel Gasoline Coal OtherFuel1 OtherFuel2 Steam DistrictHeatingWater and DistrictCooling. If this field is blank the default second fuel type is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does a default value of 4.0 for the 'Earth Tube Dimensionless Solution Space Width' parameter imply?
output: It means that the width of the solution space is four times the radius including soil one radius length beyond the edges of the tube on either side of the earth tube.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Algorithm in the SurfaceProperty:HeatTransferAlgorithm:Construction object?
output: Field: Algorithm is used to determine the heat transfer algorithm that is to be applied to the surfaces with the type of construction listed in the next field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: What does the 'Initial Value' field specify in ExternalInterface:FunctionalMockupUnitImport:To:Variable?
output: This field contains the initial value that is used during the system sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does 'DrawThrough' fan placement mean?
output: It means that the unit consists of an outdoor air mixer followed by the DX cooling coil and heating coil with the fan located at the outlet of the PTAC. The fan draws air through the DX cooling coil and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What does the 'Fanger Thermal Comfort Heating Schedule Name' field specify?
output: The name of the associated schedule containing heating setpoint Zone Thermal Comfort Fanger Model PMV values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How can users redefine meter names and control electrical loads?
output: Users can use the Output:CustomMeter objects to redefine meter names and to control what electrical loads are included on them in a flexible manner.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What is the keyword 'HumidityRatio' used for in the Controller:WaterCoil inputs?
output: The keyword 'HumidityRatio' is used for humidity control and would normally be specified for a dehumidifier outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 1 energy input ratio modifier curve (flow fraction)?
output: HPACCOOLEIRFF Speed 1

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: How does the SurfaceProperty:HeatTransferAlgorithm:Construction object differ from the HeatBalanceAlgorithm object?
output: The HeatBalanceAlgorithm is used to control the heat transfer model in an overall way while the SurfaceProperty:HeatTransferAlgorithm:Construction object can be used to revise the algorithm selections for specific constructions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> table
input: What is the ambient temperature indicator?
output: Outdoors

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: When will the total heating load be less than the reported VRF total heating capacity?
output: The total heating load will be less than the variable refrigerant flow total heating capacity reported when piping losses are modeled (i.e. when piping losses are < 1).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Fan Total Efficiency' represent?
output: This value is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power. It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: HVACSystemRootFindingAlgorithm -> text
input: How does the BisectionThenRegulaFalsi selection work?
output: The BisectionThenRegulaFalsi selection requires the program to apply the bisection method first. After the number of iteration is above the value defined in the next field the RegulaFalsi algorithm will be applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the efficiency of the electric heating coil?
output: In many cases this efficiency for the electric coil will be 100%.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is required for the Field: Name input?
output: This input must match the name of a material defined elsewhere within EnergyPlus.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the value of Coefficient2 for the fan power ratio curve?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What does the HeatExchanger:Desiccant:BalancedFlow:PerformanceDataType1 object specify?
output: This object specifies a performance model and model coefficients for a balanced flow desiccant heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Air Terminal Outdoor Air Volume Flow Rate' output indicate?
output: This output is the amount of outdoor air entering the zone. This is the average value over the frequency being reported. The amount of outdoor air is defined as the terminal unit air volume flow rate multiplied by the fraction of outdoor air entering the air loop's outside air system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: How is the 'Low Speed Standard Design Capacity' field autocalculated?
output: This field may be autocalculated in which case it is set to a fraction of the High-Speed Standard Design Capacity determined in the following field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the Field: WaterHeater Name contain?
output: This field contains the unique name of the water heater being sized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the Pump Electricity Energy [J] measure?
output: It measures the electric power input to the pump motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: To which meter is the WalkIn electric defrost heater(s) electricity consumption output added?
output: This output is added to a meter with Resource Type = Electricity End Use Key = Refrigeration Group Key = Building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What happens if the 'High Temperature' field is autosized?
output: If autosized this is equal to the design zone heating setpoint temperature described below so that the capacity at high temperature is zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> listing
input: What is the total heating capacity modifier curve Speed 1 (flow fraction) for the heat pump heating coil in the example input?
output: HPACHeatCapFF Speed 1

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is Cooling Coil Sensible Cooling Rate?
output: It is the rate of Sensible heat transfer taking place in the coil at the operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: Is the design volumetric flow rate used by the night ventilation manager?
output: No this input is not currently used by the night ventilation manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What must be left blank to apply the hybrid ventilation manager to a controlled zone not served by any air loop?
output: The HVAC air loop name input field must be left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the output for Boiler Diesel Rate?
output: HVAC Average Boiler Diesel Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the Zone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Sensible Cooling Energy output field report?
output: This output field reports the moist air sensible heat extraction of the packaged terminal air conditioner from the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Design Condenser Inlet Temperature' input specify?
output: This numeric field contains the chiller's condenser inlet design temperature in Celsius. The default value for this field is 30º C and is only used when the Design Chilled Water Flow Rate is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: Which surface is used for control in the SurfaceFaceTemperature and SurfaceInteriorTemperature options?
output: The surface used for control is the surface listed in Field: Surface Name or Radiant Surface Group Name. If a group of surfaces is entered the first surface in the radiant group is used for control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What type of motor retrofit does Carrier offer for fan coil units?
output: Carrier offers a retrofit VSD motor for fan coil units.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> listing
input: What is the thermal absorptance of the material defined in the example IDF listing?
output: The thermal absorptance of the material defined in the example IDF listing is 0.9000000.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> equation
input: What is the equation for the Leaving Dry-Bulb Function of Entering Dry-Bulb and Humidity Ratio Curve?
output: curve = C1 + C2*edb + C3*edb**2 + C4*ew + C5*ew**2 + C6*edb*ew

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When should the Leak Rate Coefficient field be used?
output: It should only be used when the Compressor type is Scroll.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What may be used to more accurately represent the performance of non-electric boilers?
output: A normalized efficiency performance curve may be used to more accurately represent the performance of non-electric boilers but is not considered a required input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How are the results of the latent heat addition for the timestep being reported processed?
output: The results (latent heat addition only) are summed for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> list
input: What are the outputs related to the Tubular Daylighting Device?
output: Outputs include transmitted solar radiation rate pipe absorbed solar radiation rate heat gain rate heat loss rate beam solar transmittance beam visible transmittance and diffuse solar transmittance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What are the rate and volume of water the Supply Water Storage Tank was not able to provide?
output: These are the rate and volume of water the Supply Water Storage Tank was not able to provide. The starved water is assumed to come from the mains. The fluid cooler's operation is not affected by a lack of storage tank water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> equation
input: What is the formula for calculating ActualWasteHeat at SpeedLevel x?
output: ActualWasteHeat@SpeedLevel(x) = ActualPower@SpeedLevel(x) × WasteHeatFrac@SpeedLevel(x) × WasteHeatTempModFac@SpeedLevel(x)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: When is the heating supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the autosized heating supply air flow rate field required?
output: This input field is required when the Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingAirflow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is the field for Cooling Only Mode used?
output: This field is only used if Cooling Only Mode is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the 'Water Outlet Node Name'?
output: The 'Water Outlet Node Name' is the name of the water coil outlet from the chilled water loop i.e. Cooling Coil Water Outlet Node. It is from this node that the operating output for water is reported to the coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Using EnergyPlus as a Library -> text
input: Do meters need to be requested prior to running a simulation in EnergyPlus?
output: No meters do not need to be requested prior to running a simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What happens if the collector is mounted on a flat roof?
output: If the collector is mounted on a flat roof its tilt-adjusted height is zero and the program will use this gap thickness as a length scale rather than the height from the previous field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is specified by the 'Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function of Temperature Curve Name' field?
output: It specifies the name of a bivariate curve or table object that parameterizes the variation of the energy input ratio (EIR) for a specific speed as a function of the wet-bulb temperature of the air entering the evaporator section and the dry-bulb temperature of the air entering the condenser section.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the 'Pipe Length' field?
output: It is the total length of the pipe (in meters).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: This calculation uses the total energy from lights and the fraction visible to realize this value summed over the space or zones in the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: Which outputs are only available for water-cooled chillers?
output: The following three outputs are only available for water-cooled chillers: HVACAverageChiller Heater Condenser Inlet.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What does the program calculate when using reflections?
output: The program calculates beam and sky solar radiation that is reflected from exterior surfaces and then strikes the building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What is the constant coefficient (C1) in the humidity ratio equation?
output: The constant coefficient (C1) in the humidity ratio equation shown above is specified as RWO.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: Why is the Heat Recovery Inlet High Temperature Limit useful?
output: This is useful to restrict the chiller lift from becoming too high and to avoid overheating the hot water loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Site:Location -> Field: Longitude -> text
input: What does the Longitude field represent?
output: This field represents the longitude (in degrees) of the facility.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: Why does operative temperature control tend to affect equipment capacities during sizing?
output: Operative temperature control tends to increase the equipment capacities calculated during sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What happens if the maximum source temperature field is not entered?
output: If this field is not entered the maximum source temperature control is not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: IDD Conventions -> text
input: What is the conversion factor from m3/MJ to ft3/kWh?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What does the 'Evaporative Cooler Storage Tank Water Volume' output variable indicate?
output: The water consumption is the water evaporated from the pad and only includes the direct thermodynamics of water evaporation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What role does the fan pressure rise play?
output: It plays a role in determining the amount of energy consumed by the fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What are the allowed inputs for the Cooling Design Capacity Method?
output: Input allowed is either None CoolingDesignCapacity CapacityPerFloorArea and FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is required for the control scheme of the ice storage?
output: It requires that a setpoint be placed by a set point manager on the ice storage Plant Outlet Node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is contained in the Maximum Cycling Rate field?
output: This numeric field contains the maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor which occurs at 50% run time fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the Heating Design Capacity field represent?
output: This field is the radiant-convective water baseboard rated capacity in watts at a rated water mass flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the Field: Heating Low Air Temperature Schedule Name specify?
output: This field specifies the low air temperature in degrees Celsius for the temperature control of a ventilated slab.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the Width Factor for Opening Factor n?
output: The Width Factor of the rectangular window or door for Opening Factor n is the opening width divided by the window or door width. The range is 0.0 to 1.0 with a default value of 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is the nature of air flows through windows and doors specified?
output: The nature of the air flows is specified using AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:DetailedOpening and AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:SimpleOpening objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is the Cooling And Discharge Mode Available field required?
output: This field is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: Where are the terminal unit type and name specified for air loop equipment?
output: They are defined in the AirloopHVAC branch.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Heating Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name' field specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the name of a biquadratic or cubic performance curve object that defines the variation in DX coil heating capacity as a function of inlet fluid (air and water) temperatures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: In what units are the temperatures used in the Heat Recovery Electric Input to Output Ratio Modifier Function of Temperature?
output: The temperatures are in degrees Celsius when used in the function.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: Where will Standard Ratings using this field be reported?
output: Standard Ratings using this field will be reported in the '2023 Standard Ratings for DX Coils' table.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: How should the Wind Speed Profile Exponent and Wind Speed Profile Boundary Layer Thickness be set?
output: They should be set to match the values associated with the Terrain field of the Building object or the equivalent fields of the Site:HeightVariation object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the source side typically do?
output: Typically the source side draws somewhat warm water from the tank and returns colder water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 4 Secondary Coil Air Flow Rate?
output: autosize

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What does the 'Plant Connection 2 Outlet Node Name' field specify about the plant loop?
output: This is the outlet from the component model to the second plant loop that is connected to the air terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the conductivity value at 20°C?
output: The conductivity value at 20°C is the one specified with the basic material properties of the regular material specified in the name field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: Why do the Source side connection flow rates need to be reported before the tank's volume can be sized?
output: Because of the complexity of such a water heater and the timing for when sizing calculation happen inside EnergyPlus.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does ASHRAE research indicate about dry-bulb and wet-bulb temperatures?
output: ASHRAE research indicates that dry-bulb and wet-bulb temperatures typically follow the same profile so EnergyPlus can use the default profile to generate humidity conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: How is blowdown characterized in terms of solids?
output: It is characterized as the ratio of solids in the blowdown water to solids in the make-up water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Plant-Condenser Flow Control -> text
input: In what situations might a thermal storage tank become warmer than necessary?
output: In certain solar hot water and heat recovery situations a thermal storage tank may become warmer than is necessary or allowable for safe use of the hot water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What is the maximum part load ratio for the boiler?
output: The maximum part load ratio for the boiler is 1.2.
